metadata.Title: CVE-2018-1312 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
In Apache httpd 2.2.0 to 2.4.29, when generating an HTTP Digest authentication challenge, the nonce sent to prevent reply attacks was not correctly generated using a pseudo-random seed. In a cluster of servers using a common Digest authentication configuration, HTTP requests could be replayed across servers by an attacker without detection.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-1312` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

apache2 - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.1
apache2-bin - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.1
apache2-data - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.1
apache2-suexec-custom - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.1
apache2-suexec-pristine - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.1
apache2-utils - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: apache2 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.29-1ubuntu4.1').
